intro: Garnotia tenuis var. angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved garnotia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, narrow leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are often pink or purple and bloom during the warmer months. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and floral display.
